description: OpenAI said it has 'full confidence' in Altman and tried to show investors and customers that it is moving past the internal conflicts that nearly destroyed it last year and made global headlines.
title: OpenAI reinstates CEO Sam Altman to board after investigation

description: The absence of ice impacts everything from businesses that rely on outdoor sports to fish that use ice to protect themselves from predators during spawning season. It also makes the shoreline more susceptible to erosion, increasing potential damage to coastal infrastructure.
title: December 2023 to February 2024 was the warmest US winter on record

description: In his State of the Union address, the US president proposed raising the corporate tax rate from 21% to 28% and called for a minimum tax.
title: Biden proposes a tax raise on billionaires, corporations, and portrays Trump as the candidate of the rich

description: Recep Tayyip Erdogan hinted that the upcoming local elections would be his last vote. He was re-elected for a five-year term in May 2023.
title: Erdogan says March local elections will be his 'last'

description: The trail of Jan Marsalek, one of the former directors of the German online payment company that went bankrupt after balance sheet manipulation, was lost in June 2020. Since then, media reports have claimed that he is working for Russian intelligence services.
title: Jan Marsalek, from Wirecard fraudster to spy for Russia

description: Since 1947, the International Court of Justice in The Hague has issued rulings on conflicts around the world, from Israel's offensive in Gaza, Russia's invasion of Ukraine and even whether some states are more to blame for the effects of global warming.
title: Behind the scenes at the International Court of Justice

description: Lara Trump was elected to be the co-chair of the Republican National Committee, securing even more Trump allies in positions of power ahead of this year's presidential election.
title: Trump's daughter-in-law elected to Republican Party leadership role

description: Joe Biden would like to set up an 'emergency mission' in order to increase the amount of humanitarian aid. The vague initiative would take many weeks to implement.
title: US explores 'temporary pier' for Gaza aid delivery, without altering its support for Israel

description: A Guardia di Finanza officer is said to have collected confidential information about hundreds of people, some of them politicians close to Giorgia Meloni.
title: A privacy scandal in Italy unnerves country's politicians

description: France's largest corporations generated profits of €153.6 billion last year. Dividends, at €67.8 billion, and share buybacks, at €30.1 billion, reached unprecedented highs.
title: France's CAC 40 companies register billions of euros in profits and dividends in record year

description: On March 8, the Paris museum posted on its website four videos made with the Puissance des femmes collective, using works from its collections.
title: For International Women's Day, Paris's Musée d'Orsay teams up with a feminist collective for passionate debates

description: Borne, 62, was the second woman to serve as prime minister after Edith Cresson in the 1990s.
title: Former PM blasts 'insidious sexism' in French politics

description: France on Friday officially inscribed the guaranteed access to abortion in its Constitution after Parliament voted in favor of the amendment.
title: Macron says he wants abortion added to EU rights charter

description: France's president called a meeting of party leaders to clarify positions, following his remarks on allied troops in Ukraine. Far from backing down, he tried to justify his position, drawing criticism from the opposition.
title: Macron's call for 'unwavering' support for Kyiv risks isolating him on French political scene

description: French President Emmanuel Macron last month sent shockwaves around Ukraine when he refused to rule out any option in the conflict.
title: France's defense minister says sending combat troops to Ukraine 'not on table'

description: As France officially inscribed the guaranteed access to abortion in its constitution on Friday, Le Monde takes a look at how abortion rights have evolved since the landmark Veil Law in 1975.
title: Abortion rights: A history of France's legal battle

description: Until recently, polls predicted a smooth passage for both the family amendment and the care amendment.
title: Ireland holds referendums to update Constitution on women, family

description: The speech given by Abraham, co-director of the award-winning documentary 'No Other Land', has sparked an outcry on social media and in the Israeli press.
title: Who is Israeli journalist Yuval Abraham, who has called for a ceasefire in Gaza?

description: The American president demonstrated his tamina during the annual address delivered to Congress, portraying his rival as a man of the past, without naming him.
title: Biden delivers forceful State of the Union Address, striking sharp contrast against Trump

description: Despite efforts from Egyptian and Qatari mediators, and US pressure on Israel, the prospect of an end to the fighting before Ramadan has become increasingly unlikely.
title: Why Israel-Hamas ceasefire talks are stalling

description: Sweden had applied to join NATO following the Russian invasion of Ukraine, breaking with an over 200-year-old policy of neutrality, and, after objections from NATO members Turkey and Hungary were overcome, finally became the alliance's 32nd member.
title: Sweden officially becomes 32nd NATO country

description: Toriyama, 68, is a titan of Japan's manga industry, with 'Dragon Ball,' his hugely influential franchise revolving around the story of alien super-warrior Goku, having sold at least 260 million copies worldwide since its creation in 1984. He died on March 1.
title: Akira Toriyama, creator of hit manga 'Dragon Ball,' has died

description: When women voted for the first time in France in 1945, the newspaper had no female editors and wrote only a few lines on the issue. Eighty years later, everything has changed: There are as many women as men in key positions, and equality issues are widely addressed.
title: Le Monde and women: From the right to vote to #MeToo

description: Faced with soaring rents in the Portuguese capital overrun by tourists, an increasing number of employees and workers, often foreigners holding low-wage jobs, are settling in tents on the outskirts of the city.
title: Housing crisis: In Portugal, near Lisbon, precarious workers are living in makeshift camps

description: American President Joe Biden turned his State of the Union speech Thursday, March 7, into an animated argument for a second term as he laced into GOP front-runner Donald Trump for espousing "resentment, revenge and retribution" and jeopardizing freedom at home and abroad.
title: Biden attacks Trump in fiery speech, warns US democracy at risk in State of Union address

description: Through December 2024, Le Monde will be publishing a series of articles looking back on its 80-year history. Jérôme Fenoglio, our director, notes that our approach to covering the world's upheavals remains consistent with the one set forth by founder Hubert Beuve-Méry: journalism, nothing but journalism, and all journalism.
title: Le Monde turns 80: The long history of our journalism and our commitments

description: When water temperatures rise excessively, corals will expel the algae (zooxanthellae) residing in their tissues, resulting in the coral turning completely white. While corals can endure a bleaching event, they experience heightened stress levels and face increased mortality risks.
title: Fifth mass coral bleaching event in eight years underway on Australia's Great Barrier Reef

description: Progress needs to increase to 27 times the current level to eradicate the practice by 2030, as called for in the UN's Agenda for Sustainable Development.
title: More than 230 million individuals worldwide have survived female genital mutilation

description: South Africa is asking the judges in The Hague to order Israel and Hamas to stop fighting. In an initial decision handed down at the end of January, the ICJ simply ordered Israel not to commit genocidal acts.
title: Israel-Hamas war: Pretoria filed an urgent request to the International Court of Justice in reaction to first signs of famine in Gaza

description: Following in the wake of Wall Street, the index benefits from the prospects of interest rate cuts and positive corporate earnings. The upward trend is increasingly concentrated on a small number of stocks.
title: Paris Stock Exchange's CAC 40 index topped 8,000 points, a record high
